generif.text: Cardiac ankyrin repeat protein, a negative regulator of cardiac gene expression, is augmented in human heart failure.

On the basis of genetic and functional analysis of CARP mutations, ANKRD1 has been identified as a new gene associated with dilated cardiomyopathy, accounting for approximately 2% of the 231 cases studied.
Data show that ANKRD1 is a short-lived protein whose levels are tightly regulated by the 26S proteasome.
ANKRD1 is a novel DCM gene, with mutations present in 1.9% of DCM patients. The ANKRD1 mutations may cause DCM

name: ankyrin repeat domain 1

reactome.name: Regulation of lipid metabolism by PPARalpha

summary: The protein encoded by this gene is localized to the nucleus of endothelial cells and is induced by IL-1 and TNF-alpha stimulation. Studies in rat cardiomyocytes suggest that this gene functions as a transcription factor. Interactions between this protein and the sarcomeric proteins myopalladin and titin suggest that it may also be involved in the myofibrillar stretch-sensor system. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
